meanings.definition: The quality or state of being profitable.
meanings.sent1: The profitableness of the business was evident in its steady growth.
meanings.sent2: Investors were attracted to the company's profitableness.
meanings.sent3: The profitableness of the lemonade stand made the kids feel like successful entrepreneurs.
meanings.sent4: Her idea had a certain profitableness that was hard to ignore.
meanings.sent5: The profitableness of the investment was clear from the increasing returns.

meanings.definition: The ability to generate financial gain.
meanings.sent1: We need to focus on the profitableness of our new project.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the market is crucial for maximizing profitableness.
meanings.sent3: The profitableness of the fundraiser exceeded all expectations.
meanings.sent4: Her determination added a new level of profitableness to the team's efforts.
meanings.sent5: The profitableness of the stock market can be unpredictable at times.

meanings.definition: The effectiveness or usefulness in producing a profit.
meanings.sent1: The profitableness of the marketing campaign was evident in the increased sales.
meanings.sent2: Efficiency plays a key role in enhancing profitableness.
meanings.sent3: The profitableness of the new software made the company's CEO proud.
meanings.sent4: His creativity added a touch of profitableness to the project.
meanings.sent5: The profitableness of the strategy became apparent after the first quarter.
